channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Streeting urges closer trading ties with Europe to grow UK economy
item.description: Health secretary’s comments push further than government’s position on EU in wide-ranging interview A deeper trading relationship with the EU would be...

item.title: Ira ‘Ike’ Schab, one of last remaining Pearl Harbor survivors, dies aged 105
item.description: Schab was a 21-year-old navy musician aboard USS Dobbin when Japan carried out surprise attack in 1941 A second world war veteran who was among the la...

item.title: Élysée Palace staff member accused of stealing tableware worth up to €40,000
item.description: Silver steward is one of three people arrested in connection with alleged theft from presidential residence A silver steward employed at the Élysée Pa...

item.title: Manchester Museum seeks help to uncover hidden histories of African collection
item.description: New Africa Hub confronts colonial-era silences by asking visitors to share insights on 40,000 objects It’s a rare thing for a museum to talk about wha...

item.title: Kate Winslet tells of being body shamed and told to do ‘fat girl parts’ when young
item.description: Actor says comments from teachers and schoolmates about her size resulted in her barely eating at 19 years old Kate Winslet has described being shamed...

item.title: Liverpool fear significant lower leg injury for Isak
item.description: Liverpool fear Alexander Isak has sustained a significant lower leg injury after the striker was forced off against Tottenham on Saturday.

item.title: Trail hunting to be banned as part of new animal welfare strategy
item.description: The government says the practice is being used as a "smokescreen" for the hunting of wild animals.

item.title: Israel approves 19 new settlements in occupied West Bank
item.description: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.

item.title: In pictures: Druids descend on Stonehenge to mark winter solstice
item.description: Thousands take to the Neolithic circle to welcome the sunrise on the shortest day of the year.
